headline.print_headline: A Hunt for Genes That Betrayed a Desert People
headline.main: A Hunt for Genes That Betrayed a Desert People

docs.lead_paragraph: The centuries-old Bedouin custom of intermarriage has had devastating genetic effects, which are now being addressed by an unusual scientific team.
docs.snippet: The centuries-old Bedouin custom of intermarriage has had devastating genetic effects, which are now being addressed by an unusual scientific team.

headline.main: Hitting the Gym, Not the Vending Machine, on the Road

docs.abstract: Christopher Elliott Sounding Off column on how companies are increasingly looking for ways to make business travel healthier as health care costs rise; programs educate frequent travelers about healthy lifestyles using online journals, support groups and other technologies for wellness; description of Parksite Group's wellness program run by Com-Psyche Corp; travelers often resist changes related to diet and exercise (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: A business trip is a great excuse to eat. Just ask George Pattee, the chief executive of the Parksite Group, a marketing company for specialty building products in Batavia, Ill. ''The temptation to eat fast food is constant,'' he said. ''The real challenge has always been the evening meal. Going out with clients and ordering a steak, that's part of the routine.''
docs.snippet: Corporate wellness programs seek to educate frequent travelers about the dangers of a sedentary lifestyle punctuated by deep-fried meals.

headline.main: New York Says Poor Must Pay For Recreation

docs.abstract: Parks and Recreation Dept on July 1 plans to set membership fees of $50 to $75 a year at St Mary's Recreation Center in South Bronx and five other centers, all of them in low-income neighborhoods in Bronx, Manhattan or Brooklyn; children 17 and under will still be admitted free, and residents 55 and over will pay only $10 a year; city officials are trying to bring admission policies at six centers in line with those of 22 other recreation centers that began charging membership fees in July 2002; those fees have raised about $2 million a year; graph; map; photo (M)
docs.section_name: Front Page; New York and Region
docs.lead_paragraph: St. Mary's Recreation Center is a rare amenity in the South Bronx. Its swimming pool, gym, boxing ring and basketball courts give the neighborhood, where two in five people live in poverty, a full range of athletic choices free. But that may soon change.
docs.snippet: Starting July 1, the city will charge $50 to $75 a year to use the recreation centers, all of which are in low-income neighborhoods.
